subject: Re: test last
msgSnippet: ... Michael ... Thank you for your answer. You wrote about the advantages of the test first approach. I am already convinced that test first is the way to go,
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Russell Gold <russgold@g...> wrote:
> On Thu, 23 Sep 2004 10:12:46 -0000, Coolspot714 <coolspot714@y...>
wrote:
> > I found tons of information about test-driven development and
> > test-first, but hardly anything about writing tests after the
> > application has been developed. Any experiences?
>
> Sure, most of us have to deal with legacy code at some point.
Michael

> Feathers has even written a whole book on the subject.
> [..]
> same thing with developer unit tests.

Thank you for your answer. You wrote about the advantages of the test
first approach. I am already convinced that test first is the way to
go, but this time I just can't - the code is already there.

Too bad Micheal Feathers book isn't out yet.
